text: - My name is Cassandra Cage.

I have been at AWS for
about a year and a half now.
I support the Inside Sales division
on the Northeast Territory.
What attracted me to AWS,
I would honestly say the diversity here.
Being an African American woman,

this is probably the first
company I've ever worked for
where leadership actually looks like me.
(upbeat music)
Before coming to AWS,
I actually worked in the hardware space,
selling desktop servers, switches,

and transitioned into software
as a service coming to AWS.
To be quite honest with you,
my day to day looks absolutely different
each time I wake up.
Not only do you have to really understand
your customer's use cases
and their over all business objectives

to figure out which best
product and services best fits,

but here there's so many
different moving parts at AWS,
you have to first figure out your job
and everything that comes with the company

before you can even
provide a good solution
to your customer.
You're always learning.

There's never a day where you
don't have anything to do.
There's always a training you can do.
Starting at AWS,

it can feel like you're
drinking from a fire hose.
There's so many different things to learn.
And like I mentioned,
things are changing each and every day,
but if you have the ability to wake up

and wanna figure it out,
it's very rewarding.
(upbeat music)
